ch.powerunit.extension.spring

Interface SpringRule

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ch.powerunit.rules.TestListenerRule, ch.powerunit.TestRule

    public interface SpringRule
extends ch.powerunit.rules.TestListenerRule
    This is a TestRule to provide support to use Spring inside PowerUnit.
    Author:
    borettim

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getApplicationContext

        org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext getApplicationContext()

      • of

        static SpringRule of(int autowireMode,
                     String location,
                     String... nextLocation)
        Create a rule to support Spring.

        For instance: 

         @Rule
 public final SpringRule spring = SpringRule.of(
                AutowireCapableBeanFactory.AUTOWIRE_BY_NAME, "classpath:sample.xml");
        Parameters:
        autowireMode - The autowiring mode (of the test class).
        location - the first location for the bean context.
        nextLocation - optional additional location for the bean context.
        Returns:
        the Rule.
        See Also:
        AutowireCapableBeanFactory.AUTOWIRE_BY_NAME, AutowireCapableBeanFactory.AUTOWIRE_BY_TYPE

      • getBean

        default <T> T getBean(Class<T> requiredType)
        Get a bean from the used ApplicationContext.
        Type Parameters:
        T - THe type of the bean.
        Parameters:
        requiredType - the requiredType.
        Returns:
        the bean
        See Also:
        BeanFactory.getBean(Class)

      • containsBean

        default boolean containsBean(String name)
        Validate if a bean with a name exists.
        Parameters:
        name - the name
        Returns:
        true if the bean exists.
        See Also:
        BeanFactory.containsBean(String)

      • getBean

        default Object getBean(String name,
                       Object... arguments)
                throws org.springframework.beans.BeansException
        Get a bean, passing argument.
        Parameters:
        name - the name
        arguments - the arguments
        Returns:
        the bean
        Throws:
        org.springframework.beans.BeansException - if the bean could not be created
        See Also:
        BeanFactory.getBean(Class, Object...)
